intro: Calopyxis brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled calopyxis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories or along stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Calopyxis brevistyla is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
